 510: 	"""Check whether two curves can be joined, and how
 511: 	   First check whether a simple line joint can do the job, then with a circle arc
 512: 	   - line1                        : double[2, N] : First line to check
 513: 	   - line2                        : double[2, M] : Second line to check
 514: 	   - estimate_start, estimate_end : Py_ssize_t   : Range index for the joint fittings, relative to the closest points between both curves
 515: 	   - merge_max_distance           : double       : Curves with relative distance higher than this value can never be merged
 516: 	   - max_angle_diff               : double       : Curves with relative angle in radians higher than this value can never be merged
 517: 	   - max_rmse                     : double       : Curves can be merged when one of the fitting methods produces a Root Mean Squared Error lower than this threshold
 518: 	<---------------------------------- _MergeState  : Check result with all necessary information, check the structure definition
 519: 	"""
+520: 	cdef _MergeState result = _MergeState(merge=False, flip1=False, flip2=False, arc=False, center_x=NAN, center_y=NAN, radius=NAN, error=INFINITY, distance=NAN)

  __pyx_t_1.flip2 = 0;

  __pyx_t_1.center_x = NAN;

static char __pyx_doc_9linetrack_4filter_lines[] = "Take a list of discrete curves, smooth them, split them at angles and merge those that would make continuous curves,\n\t   such that the result is a set of smooth discrete curves\n\t   - lines                        : list<ndarray[2, N]> : List of discrete curves\n\t   - savgol_degree                : int                 : Polynomial degree of the Savitzky-Golay filters used to smooth curves\n\t   - initial_filter_window        : int                 : Size of the window of the Savitzky-Golay filter applied before doing anything else\n\t   - smoothing_filter_window      : int                 : Size of the final Savitzky-Golay filter used to smooth the resulting curves\n\t   - branch_step                  : double              : Curves are resampled to have point at this distance from one another\n\t   - min_branch_length            : double              : Minimum length (in curve length units) of intermediate curve sections, shorter sections are eliminated\n\t   - min_line_length              : double              : Minimum length of the resulting curves, shorter curves are eliminated\n\t   - max_curvature                : double              : Curves are split when their curvature in rad/unit exceeds this threshold\n\t   - curvature_filter_size        : int                 : Size of the gaussian filter used to smooth the curvature in `cut_line_angles`\n\t   - curvature_filter_deviation   : double              : Standard deviation \317\203 of the gaussian filter used to smooth the curvature in `cut_line_angles`\n\t   - merge_max_distance           : double              : Maximum distance at which two curves can be merged together\n\t   - estimate_start, estimate_end : Py_ssize_t          : Range index for the joint fittings, relative to the closest points between both curves\n\t   - max_angle_diff               : double              : Maximum relative angle in radians at which two curves can be merged together\n\t   - merge_score_threshold        : double            ""  : Maximum score at which two curves are considered candidate for merge\n\t   - max_rmse                     : double              : Maximum value of the Root Mean Squared Error with the fitted estimator to accept a merge\n\t<---------------------------------- list<ndarray[2, M]> : List of resulting discrete curves. There are no guarantees of size, number of curves or any correspondance whatsoever with the initial curves\n\t";

 707: 	"""Take a list of discrete curves, smooth them, split them at angles and merge those that would make continuous curves,
 708: 	   such that the result is a set of smooth discrete curves
 709: 	   - lines                        : list<ndarray[2, N]> : List of discrete curves
 710: 	   - savgol_degree                : int                 : Polynomial degree of the Savitzky-Golay filters used to smooth curves
 711: 	   - initial_filter_window        : int                 : Size of the window of the Savitzky-Golay filter applied before doing anything else
 712: 	   - smoothing_filter_window      : int                 : Size of the final Savitzky-Golay filter used to smooth the resulting curves
 713: 	   - branch_step                  : double              : Curves are resampled to have point at this distance from one another
 714: 	   - min_branch_length            : double              : Minimum length (in curve length units) of intermediate curve sections, shorter sections are eliminated
 715: 	   - min_line_length              : double              : Minimum length of the resulting curves, shorter curves are eliminated
 716: 	   - max_curvature                : double              : Curves are split when their curvature in rad/unit exceeds this threshold
 717: 	   - curvature_filter_size        : int                 : Size of the gaussian filter used to smooth the curvature in `cut_line_angles`
 718: 	   - curvature_filter_deviation   : double              : Standard deviation σ of the gaussian filter used to smooth the curvature in `cut_line_angles`
 719: 	   - merge_max_distance           : double              : Maximum distance at which two curves can be merged together
 720: 	   - estimate_start, estimate_end : Py_ssize_t          : Range index for the joint fittings, relative to the closest points between both curves
 721: 	   - max_angle_diff               : double              : Maximum relative angle in radians at which two curves can be merged together
 722: 	   - merge_score_threshold        : double              : Maximum score at which two curves are considered candidate for merge
 723: 	   - max_rmse                     : double              : Maximum value of the Root Mean Squared Error with the fitted estimator to accept a merge
 724: 	<---------------------------------- list<ndarray[2, M]> : List of resulting discrete curves. There are no guarantees of size, number of curves or any correspondance whatsoever with the initial curves
